This particular mix leans heavy on guitars with the latest feedback drenched songs from the legendary Swervedriver, San Francisco's Thee Oh Sees, and Fuzz, which is one of Ty Segall's many projects. episodes.description: With more amazing music than ever to choose from, the 7th Annual Big Gay Podcast includes more than 90 minutes of songs by, for, and about the LGBTQ community, from a sinuous electronic groove inspired by Paris Is Burning to a deep cut from ‘70s glitter rocker Smokey. We're also thrilled to include new tunes from iconic artists Jimmy Somerville and Marc Almond, local fare from Dust Moth, Gaytheist and Brandi Carlilie, plus sixteen other selections to rock your 2015 Pride festivities.   1. episodes.subtitle: Seattle's Earshot Jazz Festival is respected for its massive and adventurous artistic legacy. Now in its 26th year as Seattle's major annual jazz festival, Earshot is known for presenting creative masters and important emerging artists, and for finding...
episodes.description: Seattle's Earshot Jazz Festival is respected for its massive and adventurous artistic legacy. Now in its 26th year as Seattle's major annual jazz festival, Earshot is known for presenting creative masters and important emerging artists, and for finding fresh synergies between international artists and Seattle's incredibly fertile music scene. This year's Jazz-That-Matters podcast is hosted by festival organizer John Gilbreath, who is also host of KEXP's long running Jazz Theater program, and zeroes in on a creative cross section of artists appearing all around Seattle this fall. 1. Taylor McFerrin feat. Nai Palm - The Antidote 2. Battle Trance - Palace of Wind I 3. Cuong Vu - Accelerated Thoughts 4. Industrial Revelation - Walking (Without) 5. episodes.subtitle: You want diversity? KEXP's got your diversity right here. Just in time for Seattle Pride, DJ El Toro returns with the annual Big Gay Podcast, celebrating LGBT musicians in the KEXP community. This year's line-up includes local hip-hop from THEESatisfac...
episodes.description: You want diversity? KEXP's got your diversity right here. Just in time for Seattle Pride, DJ El Toro returns with the annual Big Gay Podcast, celebrating LGBT musicians in the KEXP community. This year's line-up includes local hip-hop from THEESatisfaction, tongue-in-cheek punk ditties by TacocaT and Hunx, KEXP faves Imperial Teen and The Magnetic Fields, club stompers from Trust and Bright Light Bright Light… even a song from ""The Muppet Movie."" 1. The Magnetic Fields – Andrew In Drag 2. Light Asylum – A Certain Person 3. Trust – Gloryhole 4. THEESatisfaction – Bitch 5. Sea of Bees – Gone 6. Imperial Teen – Last To Know 7. Amy Ray – Glow 8. Tara Jane O'Neil – The Rainbow Connection 9. Tenderfoot – Don't Hold Your Horses 10. TacocaT – F.U. #8 11. Hunx – Private Room 12. Lindsay Fuller – Libby 13. Kaia – When My Hair Was Long 14. AVAN LAVA – It's Never Over 15. Bright Light Bright Light – Waiting for the Feeling

episodes.subtitle: Music is a beautiful gift, bringing endless amounts of joy to our lives on a daily basis. There is new music to discover and enjoy almost every single day, and the albums and songs we already know and love are always there for us to listen to or redisc...
episodes.description: Music is a beautiful gift, bringing endless amounts of joy to our lives on a daily basis. There is new music to discover and enjoy almost every single day, and the albums and songs we already know and love are always there for us to listen to or rediscover any time we want. Sometimes words seem inadequate to describe how wonderful that is. In her latest podcast, Cheryl Waters helps you discover that in music there is always so much more than you can feel. 1. Shabazz Palaces - An echo from the hosts that profess infinitum 2. Da Cruz - Boom Boom Boom 3. The Rosebuds - Woods 4. Gold Leaves - The Ornament 5. Frazey Ford - Firecracker 6. episodes.subtitle: Celebrating 5 years on the air at KEXP, DJ Troy Nelson takes you through some his favorite artists of 2010. Says Troy, "It has been the best 5 years in my life. I am always thankful to be a part of this amazing station, and look forward to the next 5 y...
episodes.description: Celebrating 5 years on the air at KEXP, DJ Troy Nelson takes you through some his favorite artists of 2010. Says Troy, "It has been the best 5 years in my life. I am always thankful to be a part of this amazing station, and look forward to the next 5 years and beyond!" As the current year comes to a close, you may find it hard to come up with your own top 10 list of best albums of the year, but here are some of Troy's favorites, and, who knows, they may become some of your favorites too. Check out brand new music from Kentucky, New York, Minneapolis, Canada, Denver, San Francisco, and of course, Seattle, with artists including Wooden Wand, Small Black, Happy Birthday, The Fresh & Onlys, Blood Red Dancers, and more! Track list: 1. The Fresh & Onlys - Until the End of Time 2. Small Black - Search Party 3. Happy Birthday - Girls FM 4. Butts - Wiggle Drip 5. Young Rival - Modern Life 6. episodes.subtitle: As Jimmy Somerville once sang, "there's more to love than boy meets girl"-- and there's more to the queer musical universe than the usual suspects. June is Gay Pride Month and to celebrate DJ El Toro returns with the latest edition of the Big Gay Podca...
episodes.description: As Jimmy Somerville once sang, "there's more to love than boy meets girl"-- and there's more to the queer musical universe than the usual suspects. June is Gay Pride Month and to celebrate DJ El Toro returns with the latest edition of the Big Gay Podcast, featuring nineteen varied selections from an assortment of lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender musicians -- plus a couple topical tunes from the folks who love them. Viva diversity! 1. Goldfrapp - Alive 2. Shunda K feat. Cindy Wonderful - Here I Am To Save the World 3. The Redwood Plan - How the Game Is Played 4. The Soft Pack - Down on Loving 5. Owen Pallett - Lewis Takes Action 6. The Shondes - My Dear One 7. Parenthetical Girls - Evelyn McHale 8. Ozomatli - Gay Vatos in Love (Live on KEXP) 9. Ships - Up and Down 10. Logan Lynn - Feed Me to the Wolves 11. Hidden Cameras - Underage (Holy Fuck remix) 12. Mary Gauthier - Sideshow 13. The Endtables - Process of Elimination (unedited version) 14. John Grant with Midlake - Sigourney Weaver 15. Baby Dee - Lilacs 16. Stephenhero - I Will Sleep 17. Matmos and So Percussion - Treasure 18. Andy Bell feat. Perry Farrell - Honey If You Love Him 19. Morel - Shoegazer Disco (Linus Loves mix)
episodes.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 205 - The Big Gay Podcast 2010

episodes.subtitle: It's 2010 and you're super up on your knowledge of dungeons, but what about dragons? In this Music that Matters Podcast, DJ Sharlese takes you on an epic listening journey of dragon knowledge complete with a victorious track listing! Bring your sword, ...
episodes.description: It's 2010 and you're super up on your knowledge of dungeons, but what about dragons? In this Music that Matters Podcast, DJ Sharlese takes you on an epic listening journey of dragon knowledge complete with a victorious track listing! Bring your sword, knight outfit, and blow-up castle to jump on 'cause you're going on an adventure! 1. Karl Blau - Before Telling Dragons 2. Blitzen Trapper - Dragon's Song 3. Clues - Remembered Severed Head 4. 764-Hero - Dragon 5. Sunset Rubdown - Dragon's Lair 6. Blackalicious - Cliff Hanger 7. Of Montreal - Faberge Falls for Shuggie 8. James Pants - Dragonslayer 9. The Keeper - Sharpen The Axes 10. Partman Parthorse - At The Mall 11. Black Daisy - The Dragon 12. Onry Ozzborn - It's True (featuring Cape Cowen of Dark Time Sunshine, Awol One produced by Ecid)
episodes.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 203 - Dragon!

episodes.subtitle: Discover your place in the world with this musical walkabout presented by Kevin Cole, featuring Scottish pop from Teenage Fanclub, Chilean rap from Ana Tijoux, Australian anxiety rocker from Eddy Current Suppression Ring, new old school funk from Brook...
episodes.description: Discover your place in the world with this musical walkabout presented by Kevin Cole, featuring Scottish pop from Teenage Fanclub, Chilean rap from Ana Tijoux, Australian anxiety rocker from Eddy Current Suppression Ring, new old school funk from Brooklynites Sharon Jones and the Dap-Kings, plus much more! 1. The Secret History - My Life with the Living Dead (The World That Never Was, Le Grand Magistery) 2. The Lodger - Have A Little Faith In People (Flashbacks, Slumberland) 3. Club 8 - Western Hospitality (The People's Record, Labrador) 4. The Redwood Plan - How The Game Is Played (Racing Towards the Heartbreak, Fish the Cat) 5. Male Bonding - Year's Not Long (Nothing Hurts, Sub Pop) 6. Sharon Jones and the Dap-Kings - (I Learned the Hard Way, Daptone) 7. Ana Tijoux - 1977 (1977, Nacional) 8. Head Like A Kite - Let's Start It All Again (featuring Asya Smoosh) (Dreams Suspend Night, self-released) 9. Woods - Blood Dries Darker (At Echo Lake, Woodsist) 10. Teenage Fanclub - Baby Lee (Shadows, Merge) 11. Lali Puna - Remember (Our Inventions, Morr) 12. Annuals - Sweet Sister (Sweet Sister, Lefse Records) 13. Eddy Current Suppression Ring - Second Guessing (Rush to Relax, Goner) 14. Wooden Shjips - Loose Lips (Vol. 2, Sick Thirst Records) 15. Disappears - Magics (Lux, Kranky)
episodes.title: Music That Matters, Vol. 202 - Flash Forward Now!

description: Straight from the knowledgeable KEXP DJs to your ears, now you can listen to a wonderfully eclectic mix of full length songs. KEXP brings you the music that matters from some of its favorite artists from the Pacific Northwest and around the world. See what KEXP's all about at KEXP.ORG.
title: KEXP Presents Music That Matters
